Only Theodora's Byzantines may build this unit. Attacks with lethal Greek Fire, making it the first naval unit with a ranged attack. This unit fights at +50% strength against other naval units. It cannot enter Deep Ocean tiles outside of the city borders.

+25% [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People generation in this City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Missionaries purchased in this city begin with +1 [ICON_MOVES] Movement and have no Sight Penalty.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Does not require Fresh Water.

The unique Stoudion is Theodora's Byzantium's replacement for the Garden, however, it does not require fresh water. Producing a small amount of [ICON_PEACE] Faith over the Garden, the Stoudion benefits your Missionaries by granting then an additional [ICON_MOVES] Movement and removing their Sight Penalty when they are born. Ensure that you build Stoudions at your centres for religious propagation.

The Monastery of Stoudios, more fully Monastery of Saint John the Forerunner "at Stoudios", often shortened to Stoudios, Studion, or Stoudion, was historically the most important monastery of Constantinople (modern-day Istanbul), the capital of the Byzantine Empire. The residents of the monastery were referred to as Stoudites (or Studites). Although the monastery has been derelict for half a millennium, the laws and customs of the Stoudion were taken as models by the monks of Mount Athos and of many other monasteries of the Orthodox world; even today they have influence.
